Description: Fragment of undyed linen plain weave with a large fragmentary tapestry medallion (c.23x24cm); centre of the medallion is decorated with a male human figure wearing a cloak/mantle and walking/running to the left, the right arm, which held an object, is not represented and the head is represented with a block of colour but it is only roughly head shaped (the face may be represented on the right?); the central medallion is surrounded by a freize of lions and rabbits, running, with purple fur and detail in undyed linen, the background is purple and beige (created by using alternatively purple and beige weft); plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/17), weft-undyed linen (S/9); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/7), weft-undyed linen (S24), purple wool (S/40); flying thread: undyed linen (S)
Curator's comments: stored in black box; treatment of the main figure is uncommon and some threads appear brighter than in other parts, some detail may nave been re-done at an unknown date
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
